sub_topic: Using the Fourier transform to solve electromagnetic problems
message_1:
Suppose a function f(x) has a Fourier transform F(ω) such that F(ω) = 0 for all |ω| > 5. 
If we know that f(x) is a real-valued function, what is the maximum value of the frequency domain function |F(ω)|?
message_2: Since F(ω) = 0 for all |ω| > 5, the maximum value of the frequency domain function |F(ω)| must occur within the range -5 ≤ ω ≤ 5. However, we do not have enough information about the specific function f(x) or its Fourier transform F(ω) to determine the exact maximum value of |F(ω)| within this range.
